S;[jo/m8YjRpjS@BSp,j.text: First of all, create a custom block that will contain your attack (click "make a block") in More Blocks)

u*M7@G]%}+MY6V2fBG9C.text: Then , connect the [define (...)] block with scripts there --------------->

JQ/[F?*;@#/1VqJZS.j+.text: Then create a new broadcast. It can be named whatever you want, but all attacks are named g.att_(name), so you can name it like this if you want

9CjT+D:-Aulf7O0vWw|s.text: Now, you have to make stuff happen after the broadcast. Go to g_attack3 sprite and follow second part of tutorial there. After that,  your attack block will be a fully working attack!

8ls8I0q#H1ifKKiYpl0k.text: Tell attack sprite to execute your attack and wait until it ends

d)OX92s-5efgI#E*Opj`.text: Also, you probably don't want to click "clean up" here

O~/z4Hbr.6HXbMj8K@*g.text: Attacks are choosen randomly. However, this doesn't make creating progressive battles impossible. To make one, you have to do a few things, but it's very easy.

vu2`M/{DM1vB@pW69jwr.text:
1. Add this block ----------------------------------->
to "Put attack 2 here", "Put attack 3 here!" and "Put attack 4 here!" blocks. This way no matter what attack gets choosen, it will get redirected to attack 1.

V4^4z=u=OJlAn75{eC.Q.text:
2. Add this ------------------------------------>
to "Put attack 1 here!" block, and add different things to the [if <> then] blocks - these will be different turns.

As you see, it checks for the value of g.turncounter variable, which unsuprisingly keeps track of turns.
Right now there are 4 turns, but you can make as many as you want. Simply copy last [if <> then] block and increase value by one. For example, look at turn 3 and turn 4. Turn 3 checks for 3, and turn 4 checks for 4. So to make turn 5, you have to make it check for 5.

You might also want to turn off monster random text in the editor and add the [say slowly...] block to every turn instead. This way, monster will also say something different every turn.

If you still don't get it, see this example:
https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/110483019/

4R+j]OTNQ|3n:TNzEMBm.text: things that are added by me

C29{Uvp[]R%PgY=ru%0z.text: As of update 3.25 damage detecting doesn't rely on colors anymore and is defined by a variable (this reduced a lot of lag). It's white by default (white damages as normal), but that doesn't mean attack sprite has to be white. If you set it to something other than white, set it back at the end of your attack!

input0: You have to use items from THAT ONE LINK IN THE INSTRUCTIONS.
Click "see inside", go to g_monster sprite, select more blocks from block categories and connect them with "put attack x here!" blocks.

Name for player in battle. Leave empty and it will be set to first 6 letters of username of person who is playing or Chara if someone isn't logged it. Shouldn't be longer than 6 symbols, or HP bar will glitch out.
Amount of frames you'll be invincible after you get hit. Default is 9. Note that 1 invincibility frame lasts 3 scratch frames, and scratch runs at 30 frames per second (unless it lags).
Gane over text. Leave it empty and default will be used. Use @ symbol to start a new line.
Used in Sans battle in Undertale. Makes most sense with HP higher than 50, though it'll work fine with any amount of HP.

input0: Normally, your LV is calculated from HP so it's the same as it would be in Undertale. By changing this, you can set it manually.
After you die, it will say "but it refused" and you wil respawn, like in [spoiler]Asriel Battle[/spoiler]. 1 means it's on, 0 means it's off.
Monster avoids every attack. Can be turned off with a custom block in g_monster sprite 1 means it's on, 0 means it's off..
